paragraphs.content: Psalm 66
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 66

paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Song or Psalm.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Song or Psalm.

paragraphs.content: Make a joyful noise unto God, all ye lands:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Make a joyful noise unto God, all ye lands:

paragraphs.content: Sing forth the honour of his name: make his praise glorious.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Sing forth the honour of his name: make his praise glorious.

paragraphs.content: Say unto God, How terrible art thou in thy works! through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies submit themselves unto thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Say unto God, How terrible art thou in thy works! through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies submit themselves unto thee.

paragraphs.content: All the earth shall worship thee, and shall sing unto thee; they shall sing to thy name. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All the earth shall worship thee, and shall sing unto thee; they shall sing to thy name. Selah.

paragraphs.content: Come and see the works of God: he is terrible in his doing toward the children of men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Come and see the works of God: he is terrible in his doing toward the children of men.

paragraphs.content: He turned the sea into dry land: they went through the flood on foot: there did we rejoice in him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He turned the sea into dry land: they went through the flood on foot: there did we rejoice in him.

paragraphs.content: He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.

paragraphs.content: O bless our God, ye people, and make the voice of his praise to be heard:
paragraphs.contentHtml: O bless our God, ye people, and make the voice of his praise to be heard:

paragraphs.content: Which holdeth our soul in life, and suffereth not our feet to be moved.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which holdeth our soul in life, and suffereth not our feet to be moved.

paragraphs.content: For thou, O God, hast proved us: thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou, O God, hast proved us: thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.

paragraphs.content: Thou broughtest us into the net; thou laidst affliction upon our loins.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou broughtest us into the net; thou laidst affliction upon our loins.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water: but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water: but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.

paragraphs.content: I will go into thy house with burnt offerings: I will pay thee my vows,
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will go into thy house with burnt offerings: I will pay thee my vows,

paragraphs.content: Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.

paragraphs.content: I will offer unto thee burnt sacrifices of fatlings, with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will offer unto thee burnt sacrifices of fatlings, with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.

paragraphs.content: Come and hear, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Come and hear, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.

paragraphs.content: I cried unto him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I cried unto him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.

paragraphs.content: If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me:
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me:

paragraphs.content: But verily God hath heard me; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But verily God hath heard me; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.

paragraphs.content: Blessed be God, which hath not turned away my prayer, nor his mercy from me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed be God, which hath not turned away my prayer, nor his mercy from me.
